metadata.title: CVE-2021-40346 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
An integer overflow exists in HAProxy 2.0 through 2.5 in htx_add_header that can be exploited to perform an HTTP request smuggling attack, allowing an attacker to bypass all configured http-request HAProxy ACLs and possibly other ACLs.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-40346` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

haproxy - 2.2.9-2ubuntu2
vim-haproxy - 2.2.9-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: haproxy package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.9-2ubuntu2').
